0.name: Augusta
0.description: Philip Huff Jones' Winfield, named for his wife. Finch tried to present it to her as a gift, but as she would not accept the tribute, it unceremoniously entered the arsenal of his men.

1.name: Bayou Phoenix
1.description: Ornamented with every shade found within the heart of a blazing fire, this Winfield M1873C Marksman is said to always find itys way back into the bayou, ready to rise to any occasion.

2.name: Vagrant
2.description: A vagrant known as the tin-man rattled around the city with a large bag of cans, harmless until a malicious Hunter threw them into the bay. Able to save but a few, he decorated his Winfield M1873C Silencer with the remainder, and set out for revenge – silent as a whisper.

3.name: Fire Torn
3.description: Charred but not destroyed, this Sparks LRR is not a testament to the destructive power of fire, but to the resilience of that which withstands it. A symbol of hope for rejuvenation.

4.name: Louisiana Lustrum
4.description: The AHA awards those Hunters who've reached a level 5 in prestige with this customized Sparks LRR.

5.name: The Reckoning
5.description: Sarah Burton arrived in the Bayou with five bullets. Five bullets engraved with five names, each a promise to fulfill her oath and take revenge on those who had ended her mother's life. Burton's Sparks LLR carries the bullets destined to restore justice to the Burton family.

6.name: Corvus
6.description: Graceful and ominous, like a crow gliding towards its prize, this elegant cane becomes a deadly sabre when blood needs to be spilled. Its handle aims to terrorize its victims, and the horror in their eyes is a proof of success.

7.name: Cypress Thorn
7.description: A favorite of Hunters who prefer to stalk silent and deadly through the swamps as they track their prey. One of many sabers that found themselves anything but obsolete in the bayou.

8.name: Mot Juste
8.description: This Cavalry Sabre is a Riposte bayonet that, in the spirit of scathing retort, is often just the thing to retake the initiative.

9.name: The Executioner
9.description: A sharp axe is an executioner's most thrusyed tool, and this Combat Axe can slice trhought the flesh od a pumpkin as easly as it can sever the neck of a man.

10.name: Malice
10.description: Crafted with rage and wielded with malice, this gruesome combat axe came to be when a desperate Hunter was forced to repair the blade in the field with barbed wire in the midst of a revenge-fueled melee slaughter.

11.name: Arlington Grave
11.description: this blade is older than Sgt. Bridgewater himself, and it save his life on more than one occasion. A testament to his own brand of loyalty, he wields it like furious Machete, carrying unto his own end.

12.name: Blood Orchid
12.description: A deadly machete-like Dao blade with a red cloth hung from its hilt - both to bring luck and to confuse the eye of the enemy as the blade swings towards their heart.

13.name: Black Wight
13.description: The cruel machete of infamous Hunter Lynch. Beneath the stains, engraved markings reveal its original prupose as part of a huge steel printing plate.

14.name: Black Hand
14.description: Once property of Reverend Jeremiah, who was alleged to be the first Immolator. The inscription - added later by another Hunter who stole the Caldwell from his house - is a ward against that which Hunters fear most: all-consuming fire.

15.name: Alison
15.description: A sentimental Caldwell with an elegant design. Property of Jos McGowan, and a gift from Alison Davis, given after the pair cashed in their first bounty.

16.name: The Marwood
16.description: A shot from this Caldwell Rival 78 can wake tge dead and put them back in the ground. Fashioned from the wood of a hanging tree, and adorned with the rope of a well-worn noose.

17.name: Altar Boy
17.description: A fine ornamental Lebel rifle, belonging to Reverend Ishim Gird. Never intended for action, Gird keeps it as clean as the day he pucked it from his mantel to kill the first of his congregation to get through the barricade.

18.name: Swan Song
18.description: An air of finality linger in the smoke of this Lebel 1886, an urgent call to the afterlife in the ring of its shot. Know as the Swan Song, it heralds an early closing performance of those caught in its sights.

19.name: Spring Chicken
19.description: Though no newcomer to the AHA, the Hunter who bore this lightning-blessed Lebel channeled the energy of a freshly hatched Spring storm. they say lightning never strikes twice and in this case, it's because it never needs to.

20.name: Once Bitten
20.description: A brutal attack left this Lebel Marksman's bearer scarred and warry, body and gun raked and ravaged by enormous, bloody claws. From that day on that Hunter favored stealth and the sniper's perch - nerver letting another foe get close enough to see the damage - or inflict any more.

21.name: Zorngeist
21.description: Named for Hunter Michael Zorngeist, who haunted the Bayou for years, this Lebel is known— like its owner — for being versatile, playful, and dangerous.
